intro: Hieracium neoherrerae, commonly known as the Neoherrera's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk, typical of the Asteraceae family. Hieracium neoherrerae is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
